articles.title: Lighthouse reopens after months of delays
articles.description: PORT ISABEL — For anyone who’s missed the view from atop the Port Isabel Lighthouse, the wait is finally over.

articles.author: MARK REAGAN | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Lawsuit alleges housing discrimination in Port Isabel
articles.description: A lawsuit filed in federal court late Monday afternoon alleges that city leaders in Port Isabel discriminated against low-income Hispanic residents in the years following Hurricane Dolly.

articles.author: NADIA TAMEZ-ROBLEDO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Port Isabel celebrates grand reopening of lighthouse
articles.description: PORT ISABEL — As a lifelong Rio Grande Valley resident, Valerie Barrientos of La Feria has long wanted to climb the historic steps of the Port Isabel Lighthouse. It was still closed when she visited in September, at the tail-end…

articles.author: RAUL GARCIA | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Port Isabel woman dies after being hit by motorcyclist
articles.description: PORT ISABEL — Elizabeth Sweeten could often be seen walking around town.

articles.author: NADIA TAMEZ-ROBLEDO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Port Isabel hands Yacht Club restoration to new buyer
articles.description: Port Isabel officials’ plans to rehabilitate the historic Yacht Club Hotel came to a close in February, when the city sold the building to a local family.

articles.author: MARK REAGAN | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Former Port Isabel HS teacher accused of improper relationship with student
articles.description: The Precinct 1 Constable’s Office has arrested and charged a former Port Isabel High School coach and math teacher with having a sexual relationship with a student.

articles.author: KAILA CONTRERAS | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Falcon, kite released after recovering at Gladys Porter Zoo
articles.description: After being cared for and rehabilitated by the Gladys Porter Zoo veterinary staff since late August, a peregrine falcon and a white-tailed kite were released Wednesday back into the wild at the intersection of Old Port Isabel Road and Highway…

articles.author: MARK REAGAN | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: LNG opponents deliver public comment to TCEQ
articles.description: Opponents of the proposed Rio Grande liquefied-natural gas pipeline near South Padre Island delivered nearly 2,000 public comments on Monday to the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality headquarters in Austin.

articles.author: DIANA EVA MALDONADO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Anglers banned from local fishing spots because of freezing weather
articles.description: The freezing weather has forced Texas Parks and Wildlife Department to issue a temporary closure to saltwater fishing in the Rio Grande Valley and other counties along the Texas Gulf coast.

articles.title: Update: New UIL district alignments announced
articles.description: The following are the new local Class 6A district alignments:

articles.author: STAFF REPORT
articles.title: Monitor names new deputy editor in editorial restructure
articles.description: McALLEN — The Monitor has promoted a Rio Grande Valley journalist and seasoned newsroom leader to, together with the newspaper’s publisher, oversee its editorial coverage.

articles.author: RICK KELLEY | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Gale force winds bring weather alert for Valley coastal areas
articles.description: HARLINGEN — Weather forecasters have issued a wind advisory beginning at 3 p.m. this afternoon when a strong cold front is expected to rocket into the Rio Grande Valley.

articles.author: NADIA TAMEZ-ROBLEDO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Isla Blanca Park boat ramp to close
articles.description: The Isla Blanca Park boat ramp, nearby restrooms and parking lot will close March 1 as construction of an amphitheater and multipurpose building in the Dolphin Cove area continues.

articles.author: STAFF REPORT
articles.title: McAllen sees second-straight monthly sales tax gain
articles.description: The first sales tax allocation of 2018 shows McAllen with its second straight strong monthly showing.

articles.author: BY MARK REAGAN | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Wait and See: Officials monitoring South Padre Island for fish kills
articles.description: State and local authorities are still waiting to see whether cold temperatures will result in a fish kill on South Padre Island.

articles.author: MARK MORENO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: End of the trail: Riders preserve tradition in journey to livestock show parade
articles.description: MERCEDES — Despite the expansion of the Rio Grande Valley Livestock Show and Rodeo schedule to a Thursday start, the Saturday parade for many officially marks the start of the festivities.

articles.author: STEVE CLARK | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Federal monitoring program will track foreign shrimp imports
articles.description: A decision by Congress to add imported shrimp to the Seafood Import Monitoring Program is good news for an industry not used to hearing good news.

articles.title: New York Woman, son make trek to Casa Presidente

articles.author: LORENZO ZAZUETA-CASTRO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: New prosecutors, immigration judges added for border
articles.description: McALLEN — The Department of Justice announced Wednesday the addition of 35 new assistant U.S. attorneys to offices along the U.S.-Mexico border.

articles.title: Fracking activist tries to gauge power plant emissions

articles.author: MARK MORENO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Thousands enjoy a warm H-E-B holiday meal
articles.description: MCALLEN – Empty stomachs and a mouth-watering meal met Sunday for the 27th annual H-E-B Feast of Sharing held at the Convention Center.

articles.author: MICHAEL RODRIGUEZ | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Retired drainage engineer recalls documenting Beulah
articles.description: WESLACO — With winds well exceeding 100 mph and a torrential downpour flooding city streets, it’s not uncommon to see power lines down, palm trees eerily slanted toward one direction and roofs torn off local homes and businesses.

articles.title: Remembering Beulah
articles.description: McALLEN — The end of the world.

articles.title: 50 years ago: Hurricane Beulah was making landfall near the Rio Grande
articles.description: Fifty years ago today, as Hurricane Beulah made landfall near Brownsville, Rio Grande Valley residents relied on the reports and observations of the National Weather Service’s bureau in Brownsville.

articles.title: Resilience tested: Family coping with father’s deportation, now struggles with leukemia diagnosis

articles.title: Valley man sues DHS for racial discrimination
articles.description: In a lawsuit filed against the U.S. Department of Homeland Security in federal court last week, a Brownsville man claims his employee security clearance was rescinded because of where he was born.

articles.title: At hub for border crossings, families spread throughout US

articles.author: MARK MORENO | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Protesters demand family reunification
articles.description: McALLEN — Protesters rallied Saturday to decry the separation of immigrant parents from their children by U.S. border authorities, while Democratic lawmakers said they aren't convinced the Trump administration has any real plan to reunite them.

articles.author: Mike Hixenbaugh, Lomi Kriel
articles.title: Protests continue as Trump administration moves to reunite separated families - Chron.com
articles.description:
Kristen Ruiz has never thought of herself as an activist. But one night last week, as the stay-at-home mother of three  rocked her 17-month-old  to sleep, she was overcome with sadness and anger at the thought of the government taking her children from her.
